message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education. I'm playing the role of a primary or secondary school teacher from Slovak Republic. I need to respond to 10 statements about AI in education with one of these options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a teacher in Slovakia who would have a balanced view on AI in education:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a positive use. Most teachers would agree this is helpful. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also a positive application. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - Positive application. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs - This is helpful for inclusion. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - Teachers generally appreciate help with admin work. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern about academic dishonesty. Most teachers would agree this is a real concern. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern about AI reliability. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a concern about bias. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a significant concern for teachers. I'll respond "Agree"

TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is a concern about AI understanding teaching methodology. 

For this final statement, I'll also respond "Agree" since it reflects legitimate concerns about whether AI truly grasps effective teaching practices. Now I need to call the json_tool_call function with my array of responses for all ten statements.
